author: Special Correspondent
text:
Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments (HR&CE) Minister R. Kamaraj visited Sri Ramanathaswamy Temple here on Thursday and reviewed the arrangements for the ‘kumbabishekam’ of the temple, scheduled for January 20.

Accompanied by Minister for Sports and Youth Welfare S. Sundararaj, the HR and CE Minister inspected the ‘yagasalas’, including ‘parivara yagasalas’ and ‘pradhana yagasalas’ established by the temple authorities for the conduct of ‘kaala pujas’ and 108 yaga gundams.

The Minister discussed the arrangements with Joint Commissioner of the temple S. Selvaraj and Assistant Divisional Engineer K. Mayilvahanan. In a brief chat with reporters, the Minister said that during the last four and a half years after the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam came to power, kumbabishekams were held for 8,116 temples.

On January 20, kumbabishekams would be held in 70 temples, including 40 temple administered by the HR and CE Department.
title: Minister reviews arrangements for kumbabishekam
